original_text: The spins and parities of Θ+ and Ξ−− are not yet known experimentally. In this new wave of pentaquark research, most theoretical papers take the spin equal to 1/2. The parity is more controversial. In chiral soliton or Skyrme models the parity is positive [4]. In constituent quark models it is usually positive. In the present approach, the parity of the pentaquark is given by P=(−)ℓ+1, where ℓ is the angular momentum associated with the relative coordinates of the q4 subsystem. We analyze the case where the subsystem of four light quarks is in a state of orbital symmetry [31]O and carries an angular momentum ℓ=1. Although the kinetic energy of such a state is higher than that of the totally symmetric [4]O state, the [31]O symmetry is the most favourable both for the flavour–spin interaction [12] and the colour–spin interaction [13]. In the first case the statement is confirmed by the comparison between the realistic calculations for positive parity [12] and negative parity [14], based on the same quark model [15]. In Ref. [12] the antiquark was heavy, c or b, and accordingly the interaction between light quarks and the heavy antiquark was neglected, consistent with the heavy quark limit. In Ref. [16] an attractive spin–spin interaction between s̄ and the light quarks was incorporated and shown that a stable or narrow positive parity uudds̄ pentaquark can be accommodated within such a model. This interaction has a form that corresponds to η meson exchange [17] and its role is to lower the energy of the whole system.
original_translation: Los giros y paridades de Θ+ y Ξ−− aún no se conocen experimentalmente. En esta nueva ola de investigación sobre pentaquarks, la mayoría de los artículos teóricos consideran el espín igual a 1/2. La paridad es más controvertida. En los modelos de solitón quiral o Skyrme, la paridad es positiva [4]. En los modelos de quarks constituyentes suele ser positivo. En el enfoque actual, la paridad del pentaquark está dada por P=(−)ℓ+1, donde ℓ es el momento angular asociado con las coordenadas relativas del subconjunto q4. Analizamos el caso en el que el subsistema de cuatro quarks ligeros se encuentra en un estado de simetría orbital [31]O y lleva un momento angular ℓ=1. Aunque la energía cinética de dicho estado es mayor que la del estado [4]O totalmente simétrico, la simetría [31]O es la más favorable tanto para la interacción sabor-espín [12] como para la interacción color-espín [13]. En el primer caso, la afirmación se confirma mediante la comparación entre los cálculos realistas para la paridad positiva [12] y la paridad negativa [14], basados en el mismo modelo de quarks [15]. En la Ref. [12] el antiquark era pesado, c o b, y en consecuencia la interacción entre los quarks ligeros y el antiquark pesado fue ignorada, consistente con el límite del quark pesado. En la Ref. [16] se incorporó una interacción atractiva espín-espín entre s̄ y los quarks ligeros y se demostró que un pentaquark uudds̄ de paridad positiva estable o estrecho puede ser acomodado dentro de dicho modelo. Esta interacción tiene una forma que corresponde al intercambio de mesones η [17] y su función es reducir la energía de todo el sistema.
original_sentences: The spins and parities of Θ+ and Ξ−− are not yet known experimentally.
In this new wave of pentaquark research, most theoretical papers take the spin equal to 1/2.
In chiral soliton or Skyrme models the parity is positive [4].
In constituent quark models it is usually positive.
In the present approach, the parity of the pentaquark is given by P=(−)ℓ+1, where ℓ is the angular momentum associated with the relative coordinates of the q4 subsystem.
We analyze the case where the subsystem of four light quarks is in a state of orbital symmetry [31]O and carries an angular momentum ℓ=1.

Although the kinetic energy of such a state is higher than that of the totally symmetric [4]O state, the [31]O symmetry is the most favourable both for the flavour–spin interaction [12] and the colour–spin interaction [13].
In the first case the statement is confirmed by the comparison between the realistic calculations for positive parity [12] and negative parity [14], based on the same quark model [15].
In Ref. [12] the antiquark was heavy, c or b, and accordingly the interaction between light quarks and the heavy antiquark was neglected, consistent with the heavy quark limit.

In Ref. [16] an attractive spin–spin interaction between s̄ and the light quarks was incorporated and shown that a stable or narrow positive parity uudds̄ pentaquark can be accommodated within such a model.
This interaction has a form that corresponds to η meson exchange [17] and its role is to lower the energy of the whole system.

Los giros y paridades de Θ+ y Ξ−− aún no se conocen experimentalmente. En esta nueva ola de investigación sobre pentaquarks, la mayoría de los artículos teóricos consideran el espín igual a 1/2. La paridad es más controvertida. En los modelos de solitón quiral o Skyrme, la paridad es positiva [4]. Output: En los
modelos de quarks constituyentes
suele ser positivo. En el enfoque actual, la paridad del pentaquark está dada por P=(−)ℓ+1, donde ℓ es el momento angular asociado con las coordenadas relativas del subconjunto q4. Analizamos el caso en el que el subsistema de cuatro quarks ligeros se encuentra en un estado de simetría orbital [31]O y lleva un momento angular ℓ=1. Aunque la energía cinética de dicho estado es mayor que la del estado [4]O totalmente simétrico, la simetría [31]O es la más favorable tanto para la interacción sabor-espín [12] como para la interacción color-espín [13]. En el primer caso, la afirmación se confirma mediante la comparación entre los cálculos realistas para la paridad positiva [12] y la paridad negativa [14], basados en el mismo modelo de quarks [15]. En la Ref. [12] el antiquark era pesado, c o b, y en consecuencia la interacción entre los quarks ligeros y el antiquark pesado fue ignorada, consistente con el límite del quark pesado. En la Ref. [16] se incorporó una interacción atractiva espín-espín entre s̄ y los quarks ligeros y se demostró que un pentaquark uudds̄ de paridad positiva estable o estrecho puede ser acomodado dentro de dicho modelo. Esta interacción tiene una forma que corresponde al intercambio de mesones η [17] y su función es reducir la energía de todo el sistema.

original_annotated_sentences: The spins and parities of Θ+ and Ξ−− are not yet known experimentally.
In this new wave of pentaquark research, most theoretical papers take the spin equal to 1/2.
The parity is more controversial.
In chiral soliton or Skyrme models the parity is positive [4].
In constituent quark models it is usually positive.
In the present approach, the parity of the pentaquark is given by P=(−)ℓ+1, where ℓ is the angular momentum associated with the relative coordinates of the q4 subsystem.
We analyze the case where the subsystem of four light quarks is in a state of orbital symmetry [31]O and carries an angular momentum ℓ=1.

Although the kinetic energy of such a state is higher than that of the totally symmetric [4]O state, the [31]O symmetry is the most favourable both for the
flavour–spin interaction
[12] and the colour–spin interaction [13].
In the first case the statement is confirmed by the comparison between the realistic calculations for positive parity [12] and negative parity [14], based on the same quark model [15].
In Ref. [12] the antiquark was heavy, c or b, and accordingly the interaction between light quarks and the heavy antiquark was neglected, consistent with the heavy quark limit.

In Ref. [16] an attractive spin–spin interaction between s̄ and the light quarks was incorporated and shown that a stable or narrow positive parity uudds̄ pentaquark can be accommodated within such a model.
This interaction has a form that corresponds to η meson exchange [17] and its role is to lower the energy of the whole system.

new wave of pentaquark research.translated_key: nueva ola de investigación sobre pentaquarks
original_annotated_sentences: The spins and parities of Θ+ and Ξ−− are not yet known experimentally.

In this
new wave of pentaquark research
, most theoretical papers take the spin equal to 1/2.
The parity is more controversial.
In chiral soliton or Skyrme models the parity is positive [4].
In constituent quark models it is usually positive.
In the present approach, the parity of the pentaquark is given by P=(−)ℓ+1, where ℓ is the angular momentum associated with the relative coordinates of the q4 subsystem.
We analyze the case where the subsystem of four light quarks is in a state of orbital symmetry [31]O and carries an angular momentum ℓ=1.

Although the kinetic energy of such a state is higher than that of the totally symmetric [4]O state, the [31]O symmetry is the most favourable both for the flavour–spin interaction [12] and the colour–spin interaction [13].
In the first case the statement is confirmed by the comparison between the realistic calculations for positive parity [12] and negative parity [14], based on the same quark model [15].
In Ref. [12] the antiquark was heavy, c or b, and accordingly the interaction between light quarks and the heavy antiquark was neglected, consistent with the heavy quark limit.

In Ref. [16] an attractive spin–spin interaction between s̄ and the light quarks was incorporated and shown that a stable or narrow positive parity uudds̄ pentaquark can be accommodated within such a model.
This interaction has a form that corresponds to η meson exchange [17] and its role is to lower the energy of the whole system.

En los modelos de quarks constituyentes suele ser positivo. En el enfoque actual, la paridad del pentaquark está dada por P=(−)ℓ+1, donde ℓ es el momento angular asociado con las coordenadas relativas del subconjunto q4. Analizamos el caso en el que el subsistema de cuatro quarks ligeros se encuentra en un estado de simetría orbital [31]O y lleva un momento angular ℓ=1. Aunque la energía cinética de dicho estado es mayor que la del estado [4]O totalmente simétrico, la simetría [31]O es la más favorable tanto para la interacción sabor-espín [12] como para la interacción color-espín [13]. En el primer caso, la afirmación se confirma mediante la comparación entre los cálculos realistas para la paridad positiva [12] y la paridad negativa [14], basados en el mismo modelo de quarks [15]. Esta interacción tiene una forma que corresponde al intercambio de mesones η [17] y su función es reducir la energía de todo el sistema.

Los giros y paridades de Θ+ y Ξ−− aún no se conocen experimentalmente. En esta nueva ola de investigación sobre pentaquarks, la mayoría de los artículos teóricos consideran el espín igual a 1/2. La paridad es más controvertida. En los modelos de solitón quiral o Skyrme, la paridad es positiva [4]. En los modelos de quarks constituyentes suele ser positivo. En el enfoque actual, la paridad del pentaquark está dada por P=(−)ℓ+1, donde ℓ es el momento angular asociado con las coordenadas relativas del subconjunto q4. Analizamos el caso en el que el subsistema de cuatro quarks ligeros se encuentra en un estado de simetría orbital [31]O y lleva un momento angular ℓ=1. Aunque la energía cinética de dicho estado es mayor que la del estado [4]O totalmente simétrico, la simetría [31]O es la más favorable tanto para la interacción sabor-espín [12] como para la interacción color-espín [13]. En el primer caso, la afirmación se confirma mediante la comparación entre los cálculos realistas para la paridad positiva [12] y la paridad negativa [14], basados en el mismo modelo de quarks [15]. En la Ref. [12] el antiquark era pesado, c o b, y en consecuencia la interacción entre los quarks ligeros y el antiquark pesado fue ignorada, consistente con el límite del quark pesado. Output: En la Ref. [16] se incorporó una atractiva interacción espín-espín entre
s̄
y los quarks ligeros, y se demostró que un pentaquark uudd
s̄
de paridad positiva estable o estrecha puede ser acomodado dentro de dicho modelo. Esta interacción tiene una forma que corresponde al intercambio de mesones η [17] y su función es reducir la energía de todo el sistema.

original_annotated_sentences: The spins and parities of Θ+ and Ξ−− are not yet known experimentally.
In this new wave of pentaquark research, most theoretical papers take the spin equal to 1/2.
The parity is more controversial.

In chiral soliton or
Skyrme models
the parity is positive [4].
In constituent quark models it is usually positive.
In the present approach, the parity of the pentaquark is given by P=(−)ℓ+1, where ℓ is the angular momentum associated with the relative coordinates of the q4 subsystem.
We analyze the case where the subsystem of four light quarks is in a state of orbital symmetry [31]O and carries an angular momentum ℓ=1.

Although the kinetic energy of such a state is higher than that of the totally symmetric [4]O state, the [31]O symmetry is the most favourable both for the flavour–spin interaction [12] and the colour–spin interaction [13].
In the first case the statement is confirmed by the comparison between the realistic calculations for positive parity [12] and negative parity [14], based on the same quark model [15].
In Ref. [12] the antiquark was heavy, c or b, and accordingly the interaction between light quarks and the heavy antiquark was neglected, consistent with the heavy quark limit.

In Ref. [16] an attractive spin–spin interaction between s̄ and the light quarks was incorporated and shown that a stable or narrow positive parity uudds̄ pentaquark can be accommodated within such a model.
This interaction has a form that corresponds to η meson exchange [17] and its role is to lower the energy of the whole system.

In the present approach, the parity of the pentaquark is given by P=(−)ℓ+1, where ℓ is the angular momentum associated with the relative coordinates of the q4 subsystem.
We analyze the case where the subsystem of four light quarks is in a state of orbital symmetry [31]O and carries an angular momentum ℓ=1.

Although the kinetic energy of such a state is higher than that of the totally symmetric [4]O state, the [31]O symmetry is the most favourable both for the flavour–spin interaction [12] and the colour–spin interaction [13].
In the first case the statement is confirmed by the comparison between the realistic calculations for positive parity [12] and negative parity [14], based on the same quark model [15].
In Ref. [12] the antiquark was heavy, c or b, and accordingly the interaction between light quarks and the heavy antiquark was neglected, consistent with the heavy quark limit.

In Ref. [16] an attractive spin–spin interaction between s̄ and the light quarks was incorporated and shown that a stable or narrow positive parity uudds̄ pentaquark can be accommodated within such a model.

This interaction has a form that corresponds to
η meson
exchange [17] and its role is to lower the energy of the whole system.
